description.other_details: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License. To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/.

This artefact includes content from SNOMED Clinical Terms® (SNOMED CT®) which is copyrighted material of the International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO). Where an implementation of this artefact makes use of SNOMED CT content, the implementer must have the appropriate SNOMED CT Affiliate license - for more information contact https://www.snomed.org/snomed-ct/get-snomed or info@snomed.org.

details.purpose: *To create a framework for recording answers to pre-defined screening questions about the presence of implanted medical devices or use of assistive devices. (en)
details.misuse:
*Not to be used to record answers to pre-defined screening questions about surgical/operative procedures when a medical device was implanted. Use the OBSERVATION.procedure_screening for this purpose.
Not to be used to record answers to pre-defined screening questions about medications that have been implanted. Use the OBSERVATION.medication_screening for this purpose. (en)

details.purpose: *To create a framework for recording answers to pre-defined screening questions about the presence of implanted medical devices or use of assistive devices. (en)
details.misuse:
*Not to be used to record answers to pre-defined screening questions about surgical/operative procedures when a medical device was implanted. Use the OBSERVATION.procedure_screening for this purpose.
Not to be used to record answers to pre-defined screening questions about medications that have been implanted. Use the OBSERVATION.medication_screening for this purpose. (en)

details.purpose: To create a framework for recording answers to pre-defined screening questions about the presence of implanted medical devices or use of assistive devices.
details.misuse:
Not to be used to record answers to pre-defined screening questions about surgical/operative procedures when a medical device was implanted. Use the OBSERVATION.procedure_screening for this purpose.
Not to be used to record answers to pre-defined screening questions about medications that have been implanted. Use the OBSERVATION.medication_screening for this purpose.

translations.author: Marit Alice Venheim, Silje Ljosland Bakke, John Tore Valand
Helse Vest IKT, Helse Vest IKT AS, Helse Bergen
marit.alice.venheim@helse-vest-ikt.no, silje.ljosland.bakke@helse-vest-ikt.no, john.tore.valand@helse-bergen.no, john.tore.valand@helse-vest-ikt.no

items.items: Series of questions and associated answers used to screen for the presence of implanted medical devices or use of assistive aids.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
Name of the implanted medical device or device type being screened.
Additional information required to extend the model with local content or to align with other reference models or formalisms.
For example: local information requirements; or additional metadata to align with FHIR.
Screening details about the presence of a specific implanted medical device.
For example: cochlear implant; pacemaker; joint replacement; heart valve; coronary stent; bone fixation device eg screws or plates; deep brain stimulator; intraocular lens; or contraceptive device.
The specific device is present or being used.
The specific device is not present or being used.
Additional narrative about the implanted device, not captured in other fields.
It is not known whether the device is present or absent.
For example: screening prior to a Magnetic Resonance Imaging examination.
Additional details or questions about the implanted device.
Narrative description about the implanted device.
Screening details about the use of a specific assistive medical device.
For example: wheelchair; walking stick; hearing aid; reading glasses; prosthetic limb; braille reader; speech generating device or medication organiser.
Name of the medical device or device type being screened.
The specific device is present or being used.
The specific device is not present or being used.
It is not known whether the device is present or absent.
Narrative description about the assistive aid.
Additional details or questions about the assistive aid.
Additional narrative about the assistive aid, not captured in other fields.
Indication of timing related to the implanted device.

The 'Timing' data element has deliberately been loosely modelled to support the myriad of ways that it can be used in questionnaires to capture when a medical device was implanted. The specific and intended semantics can be further clarified in a template. For example: the actual date and/or time; the dates when the implant was inserted or removed; the interval of time during which the implant was inserted; the implant duration; the age of the individual at the time the implant was inserted; or the duration of time since it was inserted or removed. A partial date is valid, using the DV_DATE_TIME data type, to record only a year.
*Series of questions and associated answers used to screen for the presence of implanted medical devices or use of assistive aids. (en)
Standard, uspesifisert tidspunkt eller tidsintervall som kan defineres mer eksplisitt i et templat eller i en applikasjon.
*Name of the implanted medical device or device type being screened. (en)
*Additional information required to extend the model with local content or to align with other reference models or formalisms. (en)
*For example: local information requirements; or additional metadata to align with FHIR. (en)
*Screening details about the presence of a specific implanted medical device. (en)

*For example: cochlear implant; pacemaker; joint replacement; heart valve; coronary stent; bone fixation device eg screws or plates; deep brain stimulator; intraocular lens; or contraceptive device. (en)

*The specific device is not present or being used. (en)
*Additional narrative about the implanted device, not captured in other fields. (en)
*It is not known whether the device is present or absent. (en)

*Additional details or questions about the implanted device. (en)
*Screening details about the use of a specific assistive medical device. (en)
*For example: wheelchair; walking stick; hearing aid; reading glasses; prosthetic limb; braille reader; speech generating device or medication organiser. (en)
*Name of the medical device or device type being screened. (en)
*The specific device is present or being used. (en)
*The specific device is not present or being used. (en)
*It is not known whether the device is present or absent. (en)
*Additional details or questions about the assistive aid. (en)
*Additional narrative about the assistive aid, not captured in other fields. (en)
*Indication of timing related to the implanted device. (en)

*The 'Timing' data element has deliberately been loosely modelled to support the myriad of ways that it can be used in questionnaires to capture when a medical device was implanted. The specific and intended semantics can be further clarified in a template. For example: the actual date and/or time; the dates when the implant was inserted or removed; the interval of time during which the implant was inserted; the implant duration; the age of the individual at the time the implant was inserted; or the duration of time since it was inserted or removed. A partial date is valid, using the DV_DATE_TIME data type, to record only a year. (en)
*Series of questions and associated answers used to screen for the presence of implanted medical devices or use of assistive aids. (en)
Standardwert, ein undefinierter/s Zeitpunkt oder Intervallereignis, das explizit im Template oder zur Laufzeit der Anwendung definiert werden kann.
*Name of the implanted medical device or device type being screened. (en)
*Additional information required to extend the model with local content or to align with other reference models or formalisms. (en)
*For example: local information requirements; or additional metadata to align with FHIR. (en)
*Screening details about the presence of a specific implanted medical device. (en)

*For example: cochlear implant; pacemaker; joint replacement; heart valve; coronary stent; bone fixation device eg screws or plates; deep brain stimulator; intraocular lens; or contraceptive device. (en)
Das betreffende Gerät ist vorhanden oder wird verwendet.
Das betreffende Gerät ist nicht vorhanden oder wird nicht verwendet.
*Additional narrative about the implanted device, not captured in other fields. (en)
Es ist nicht bekannt, ob das Gerät vorhanden ist.
Der Grund für das gesamte Screening.
*For example: screening prior to a Magnetic Resonance Imaging examination. (en)
*Additional details or questions about the implanted device. (en)
*Screening details about the use of a specific assistive medical device. (en)
*For example: wheelchair; walking stick; hearing aid; reading glasses; prosthetic limb; braille reader; speech generating device or medication organiser. (en)
*Name of the medical device or device type being screened. (en)
Das betreffende Gerät ist vorhanden oder wird verwendet.
Das betreffende Gerät ist nicht vorhanden oder wird nicht verwendet.
Es ist nicht bekannt, ob das Gerät vorhanden ist.
*Additional details or questions about the assistive aid. (en)
*Additional narrative about the assistive aid, not captured in other fields. (en)
*Indication of timing related to the implanted device. (en)

*The 'Timing' data element has deliberately been loosely modelled to support the myriad of ways that it can be used in questionnaires to capture when a medical device was implanted. The specific and intended semantics can be further clarified in a template. For example: the actual date and/or time; the dates when the implant was inserted or removed; the interval of time during which the implant was inserted; the implant duration; the age of the individual at the time the implant was inserted; or the duration of time since it was inserted or removed. A partial date is valid, using the DV_DATE_TIME data type, to record only a year. (en)
